reviewText: Not much suspense, but ok to see.

I appreciate goods and am satisfied with a result as an exhibitor's evaluation.
Moreover, I appreciate a prompt action.
Thank you.

Shannon Tweed (Days Of Our Lives in 1985-86) knows for a fact her husband is cheating on her. She goes home and hears her husband with his secretary. She doesn't let him know he got caught. She holds it in for now. The man even has the nerve to expect his wife to satisfy him. After brushing her teeth with that done, she falls asleep and has a verey erotic dream with a mysterious man. it's so steamy, so satisfying. later, the dream man gives her a key. She must run. She is scared. Suddenly, a man (Andrew Stevens) living across town wakes up. He is having the same dream of her. Shannon wakes up. There in her hand, for real, is the key the dream man gave her. This man has been drawing pictures of this mysterious woman in his dreams. It is Shannon Tweed. Will these two torn hearts ever meet? Remember the infamous scene with Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet in Titanic (1997), with Leonardo holding Kate at the front of the ship? Well, Andrew Stevens and Shannon Tweed did it first in this film.

While the scenes with Shannon Tweed aren't that great,you do get to ser her [body] quite a few times(though alot of the scenes are in a slow motion style).There are other scenes without her however,that are pretty good. The main one I'm referring to is the one with Shannon Tweed's character's husband(I can't remember her name in the movie)and the big-breasted brunette having [adult contact] against the desk in his office,and then on his couch.
At least rent this one to check it out,then draw your own conclusions.
I FEEL THAT THIS MOVIE IS AVERAGE. IT DOES START OFF SLOW BUT IT GETS GOOD AND ONCE YOU REALLY GET INTO THE MOVIE YOU ARE DISAPOINTED WITH THE ENDING. OVERALL I GIVE IT 3***.
